headline: Guardian University Awards: shortlist
text: Student experience      Sponsored by The Quality Assurance Agency for Higher Education Shortlist (Institute  project name):  Aston University - Languages for All  University of Huddersfield - MyReading software  Manchester Metropolitan University - Enhancing the Quality of Assessment for Learning (EQAL) Employability initiative  Brunel University - Brunel shines with lighting industry collaboration  University of Dundee - Scottish Internship Graduate Certificate  Edinburgh College of Art, University of Edinburgh - The Design Agency Project Teaching excellence     Future of Higher Education 2012: The higher Education Academy    Sponsored by The Higher Education Academy  University of Bristol - Dynamic Laboratory Manuals  Plymouth University - Plymouth ebook project  London School of Economics and Political Science  LSE 100 Contribution to local community  De Montfort University - Square Mile  Plymouth University - The Vice-Chancellor's Community Research Awards  University of Worcester - The Hive Outstanding research impact  King's College London - Woundcare for Epidermolysis Bullosa (WEB)  The Open University - Childrens Research Centre  University of Oxford - climateprediction.net University facilities  University of Liverpool - Central Teaching Laboratories (CTL)  Middlesex University - Single London campus  University of West Scotland  Ayr Campus Development Commitment to widening participation      Sponsored by The Open University  Oxford Brookes University - Brookes Bridges  University of Sunderland - Looked After Young People  University of Wales, Newport in participation with the University of Glamorgan - Universities Heads of the Valleys Institute (UHOVI) Sustainability project  Leeds Metropolitan University - Zero Waste to Landfill  University of Wales Trinity Saint David - A virtual sustainability institute: Institute for Sustainable Practice, Innovation and Resource Effectiveness (INSPIRE) International Strategy  University College London - International Strategy  The University of Nottingham - International Strategy  University of Salford - Salford's International Strategy: Iraq and Sri Lanka Inspiring leader      Sponsored by Leadership Foundation for Higher Education  Martin Bean, vice-chancellor, The Open University  Professor Bob Cryan, vice-chancellor, University of Huddersfield  John Dishman, director and chief executive, Coventry University College, Coventry University  Alison Johns, head of leadership governance and management at HEFCE  Tricia King, pro-vice-master for student experience and director of external relations, Birkbeck,University of London  Dr Malcolm McVicar, vice-chancellor of the University of Central Lancashire  Mike Nicholson, director of undergraduate admissions and outreach, University of Oxford  Mary Stuart, vice-chancellor, University of Lincoln To vote for the inspiring leader of the year click here The winners will be announced at the Guardian University Awards on 27 February 2013 and online on the Higher Education Network.
